    public static void main(String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception {

        for (int i = n - 1; i > 0; i--) {
            if (m % i == 0) {
                System.out.println(i + " ");
                m = i;
            }
        }
    }
}

First, the first program's code:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <limits.h>

// Function for first program
long compute_first(int v1, int v2, int t, int d) {
    int rows = t-1;
    int cols = 1150;
    long (*dp)[cols] = malloc(rows * sizeof(*dp)); // Using VLA or dynamic allocation?

    // Initialize dp
    for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) {
        for (int j = 0; j < cols; j++) {
            dp[i][j] = -1e17;
        }
    }
    dp[0][v1] = v1;

    for (int i = 1; i < rows; i++) { // since rows is t-1, i goes up to t-2
        for (int j = 0; j < cols; j++) {
            long current_max = dp[i][j];
            // first loop for x from 0 to d
            for (int x = 0; x <= d; x++) {
                if (j + x < cols) {
                    if (dp[i-1][j + x] + j > current_max) {
                        current_max = dp[i-1][j + x] + j;
                    }
                }
            }
            // second loop for x from d down to 0
            for (int x = d; x >=0; x--) {
                if (j - x >=0) {
                    if (dp[i-1][j - x] + j > current_max) {
                        current_max = dp[i-1][j - x] + j;
                    }
                }
            }
            dp[i][j] = current_max;
        }
    }

    long ans = LONG_MIN;
    for (int j = 0; j < cols; j++) {
        if (abs(j - v2) <= d) {
            if (dp[rows-1][j] + v2 > ans) {
                ans = dp[rows-1][j] + v2;
            }
        }
    }

    free(dp); // free the allocated memory
    return ans;
}

Wait, in the first program's code, cols is 1150, which is fixed. 

Therefore, in C, we can define cols as a constant. 

So, let's define:

#define COLS 1150

Then, the code can be written as:

long compute_first(int v1, int v2, int t, int d) {
    int rows = t-1;
    long (*dp)[COLS] = malloc(rows * sizeof(*dp));

    // Initialize
    for (int i =0; i < rows; i++) {
        for (int j=0; j < COLS; j++) {
            dp[i][j] = -1e17;
        }
    }
    dp[0][v1] = v1;

    for (int i=1; i < rows; i++) {
        for (int j=0; j < COLS; j++) {
            long current_max = dp[i][j];
            // first loop for x from 0 to d
            for (int x=0; x <=d; x++) {
                if (j +x < COLS) {
                    if (dp[i-1][j +x] + j > current_max) {
                        current_max = dp[i-1][j +x] + j;
                    }
                }
            }
            // second loop for x from d down to 0
            for (int x=d; x >=0; x--) {
                if (j -x >=0) {
                    if (dp[i-1][j -x] + j > current_max) {
                        current_max = dp[i-1][j -x] + j;
                    }
                }
            }
            dp[i][j] = current_max;
        }
    }

    long ans = LONG_MIN;
    for (int j=0; j < COLS; j++) {
        if (abs(j - v2) <= d) {
            if (dp[rows-1][j] + v2 > ans) {
                ans = dp[rows-1][j] + v2;
            }
        }
    }

    free(dp);
    return ans;
}

Third program's code:

int compute_third(int y) {
    int leap = is_leap(y);
    int sum =0;
    for (int i = y+1; ; i++) {
        if (is_leap(i)) {
            sum +=366;
        } else {
            sum +=365;
        }
        if (sum %7 ==0) {
            if ( (is_leap(i) == leap) ) {
                return i;
            }
        }
    }
}

The helper function is_leap:

int is_leap(int y) {
    return (y %400 ==0) || (y%4 ==0 && y%100 !=0);
}

Putting it all together in the main function:

int main() {
    int v1, v2, t, d;
    scanf("%d %d %d %d", &v1, &v2, &t, &d);

    long ans = compute_first(v1, v2, t, d);

    int n = process_second(ans); // which is ans

    int result = compute_third(n);

    printf("%d\n", result);

    return 0;
}
